data.title: Chatting with stand-up comedian Alyce Chan
data.meta_description: For this week's "Chatting With" feature we spoke with stand-up comedian Alyce Chan, incredibly relatable and jokes about her everyday life.
data.text:
For this week’s comedy feature we spoke with stand-up comedian Alyce Chan. Alyce Chan is incredibly relatable and jokes about her everyday life, including her parents and being a mom. Her delivery is spot on and will have you enjoying every minute of her set!

How would you describe your comedy style?

Dry, deadpan, self-deprecating and a touch of raginess (if that’s a word)

Who are some of your influences?

Kevin Nealon, Norm Mac Donald (Rest in Peace), Tig Notaro, Hannah Gadsby, Ali Wong, Margaret Cho, Sarah Silverman, Chelsea Handler

Who was your favourite comedian growing up?

Lucille Ball, Steve Martin, John Candy and John Ritter

Who is your favourite comedian now?

Kevin Nealon

What is your pre-show ritual?

I never eat or drink anything. I may take one small sip of water right before I go on stage but I definitely go to the bathroom at least 3 times before my set.

What is your favourite place you have performed? Why?

Caroline’s on Broadway in New York because it’s iconic, I took my first comedy class there and you get a blend of tourists and locals. And Havana Theater in Vancouver for the intimate edgy vibe and the staff couldn’t be kinder.

What is your favourite bit you have written and why were you proud of it?

I start off by telling people that I had two pregnancy scares. People get uncomfortable. A few giggles. I then expand and tell them that my pregnancy scars are actually my two kids and the room goes wild.

What is your favourite medium for listening or finding new comics/comedians?

I watch as many Netflix specials as I can. If I can go see someone I love live, that’s even better but it’s not always possible.

Do you have anything to promote right now?

Yes, I’m producing an epic all-female lineup show on August 3rd. There are two shows that night 7:30 pm and 9:45 pm. I’ll be performing with local talents such as the incredible Yumi Nagashima and Julie Kim.

Here is the link if you are interested.

People can use MOMCOMVR for $5 off

Where can we follow you?

Instagram | Website

PAY IT FORWARD: Who is another local comic/comedian we should know about?

Ed Hill
